profiles:
Experience SharePoint Product Owner/Tech Lead/Solutions Architect Avertra December 2013  – Present (1 year 9 months) -Develop and strategize road map of program/delivery methodology for different SAP and non-SAP projects 
 
-Work with clients to identify gaps in business processes, as their SME, create solutions to fill the gaps 
 
-Work closely with customers and PM's to understand and manage project delivery expectations 
 
-Architect and lead MS SharePoint platform solutions for clients 
 
-Create functional design specs, implementation plans, and test plans 
 
-Produce project artifacts such as requirements docs, governance plans, and organization readiness plans for client engagements 
 
-Provide architecture review and project milestone sessions 
 
-Develop and deploy SharePoint technical solutions and design custom code for projects SharePoint Developer/Design-SharePoint Administrator-Project Manager Intel Corporation - Intel Information Management team 2013  –  2013  (less than a year) Hillsboro, OR Designed a sustainable SharePoint infrastructure and dynamic web content management processes to achieve optimal end-user functionality and ease of use. 
 
Technical writing for web based forms and content utilizing InfoPath Designer. 
 
Technical analysis of 300+ SharePoint Production sites, automation, taxonomy and optimized infrastructure implementation. 
 
Implementation of SharePoint web-based solutions centered on accurate understanding, translation and defining of technical requirements as communicated by key stakeholders and project managers. 
 
Designed, developed and implemented a SharePoint solution to streamline and automate Intel Legal processes. The initial phase of the solution includes the use of out-of-the box and custom SharePoint workflows, integrated with a complex InfoPath form. 
 
Designed, developed and implemented a SharePoint solution to provide employee training management. The solution leverages a Microsoft training and materials management template customized with enhancements to meet the specific business requirements of the association.  
 
Designed, developed and implemented the site provisioning process and application for new SharePoint 2010 sites. SharePoint Architect-Development-Project Management-Information Architect-SharePoint Design Intel Corporation 2005  –  2013  (8 years) Hillsboro, OR Accountable for developing uniform information management practices across the Business Client Group (BCG) through implementation of consistent SharePoint collaboration processes, usage models, and web applications. I created and managed the BCG Information Management program; providing expertise, training and leadership to local and virtual teams, as well as facilitating the business relationship with Intel's IT group. I was also responsible for business operations and employee communications.  
 
Pioneered an Information Management Program Office comprised of an Information Manager from each of the eight business units across BCG. Responsible for providing strategic insight and direction for business SharePoint Portal/sites, able to drive strategic initiatives into their respective organizations. 
 
Effective communication of technical methodologies and information via end-user centric training materials I created, including a Quick How-To’s book and 60+ Quick How-To’s video demo’s I made available to end-users through a SharePoint Virtual Training Center. 
 
Designed, branded, created and managed the BCG SharePoint Portal. Established standard navigation and taxonomy for all group SharePoint sites. Implemented a global navigation solution on all BCG aggregated SharePoint sites. Developed custom solutions utilizing out-of-the-box web parts, data views, and modification XSLT code.  
 
Responsible for deployment of the Intel SharePoint Collaboration Initiative across the division. The initiative included the upgrade to Office 2007, SharePoint 2007 deployment, and migration of users and content from ~2500 existing web sites to SharePoint 2007.  
 
Created and trained 10 business sub-units to manage and maintain implementation of newly employed applications I designed for use within the SharePoint environment. 
 
Quickly identified and resolved SharePoint application issues while productively working with content experts and content owners. SharePoint Development-Information Architect Intel Corporation - New Business Initiatives Group 2004  –  2005  (1 year) Hillsboro, OR Designed, developed and implemented a SharePoint solution to provide employee training management. The solution leverages a Microsoft training and materials management template customized with enhancements to meet the specific business requirements of the association.  
 
Re-vitalized and redesigned the existing Sensor Networks Team SharePoint site infrastructure while simultaneously working with business organizations to plan, design, and help implement efficient collaboration services and technologies in support of core organizational functions and business processes. 
 
Introduced a new training approach which leveraged existing training modules and real business scenarios to demo SharePoint features and functionality as well as providing a medium to answer questions to business application of SharePoint. 
 
Developed and implemented a provisioning process for new SharePoint sites 
 
Created SharePoint metadata and content types, configuring Information Management rights and retention policies. Project Assistant CH2M HILL 2004  –  2004  (less than a year) Portland, Oregon Area Assist in processing and logging of construction documents, including submittals, RFIs (request for information) or DCVRs (design clarification/variation requests). This includes assigning due dates, routing to appropriate team member, and monitoring the documents to ensure they are returned in a timely manner for transmittal and overnight mailing(courier) to client, construction manager or contractor. Type and process DCNs (design change notices) during design phase.  
 
Prepare and FedEx domestic and international packages.  
 
When directed, prepare conference rooms for client and team meetings with required materials, including setting up bride calls, bringing in lunches, and scheduling equipment such as in-focus machines and overhead projectors for meetings. 
 
Always ask questions and take initiative so team members become aware of my willingness and ability to assist in any task including assistance in the archiving process when projects are completed. 
 
Displayed willingness and ability to learn phases of project as well as corresponding tasks so as to become vital member of project team. Administrative Assistant ProDX 2003  –  2004  (1 year) Beaverton, OR Primarily responsible for supporting company VP’s, sales and recruiting departments. 
 
Responsible for weekly and monthly reports and metrics for sales and recruiting. 
 
Responsible for tracking and maintaining documentation surrounding job orders and new clientele. 
 
Work well independently as well as in groups.  
 
Worked on corporate events, i.e. team events and social outings. 
 
Managed multiple calendars, and contact lists. 
 
Booked travel arrangements for recruiters. 
 
Reserved conference rooms, ordered lunches, corporate and meeting specific. Administrative Assistant Intel Corporation 2001  –  2003  (2 years) Hillsboro, OR Assisted in planning and organizing global company/group meetings. 
 
Assisted in the Match and Gifts grants program; organized and mailed out checks for that program. 
 
Displayed my ability to be a team player in numerous projects needing multiple associates to complete the task. Summary I am a digital marketing enthusiast specializing in growth hacking, web development, and website optimization. I started off by building a website out of my dorm room, worked hard, and grew it from nothing to 1.5 million monthly visitors, 100,000 email subscribers, and 1,000 sales a month. 
 
From there I was a Summer Business Scholar at Univ. of Chicago and joined a team that won Startup Weekend Miami. I then headed off to SXSW, started my graduate school journey, and took a year long sabbatical to work with Intel.  
 
Other interesting tidbits - I cut my teeth with a TechCrunch Disrupt winning startup out of Tel Aviv Israel, wrote for Elite Daily, and visited England and India. And it turns out I'm really bad at rock climbing and brazilian jiu jitsu (but do it anyway) 
 
Skillsets include  
- Online and Digital Marketing Strategy 
- Google Analytics, Webmaster, Adsense, and Adwords 
- Search Engine Marketing (SEM) and Search Engine Optimization (SEO) 
- Pay Per Click (PPC) Advertising 
- Data Mining, Statistical Analysis, Segmentation, and Modeling 
- SQL, Analytical Based Marketing, and Keyword Analysis 
- Email marketing campaigns, display campaigns, conversion rate optimizaiton 
- A/B Testing and Campaign Optimization 
- Landing Page Optimization, Tagging, and Analytics Reporting 
- Web and Data Analytics

The best way to contact me is through LinkedIn. Experience Business Analyst, Intern, and Information Architect Intel Corporation May 2012  –  August 2013  (1 year 4 months) Santa Clara, CA Was one of those interns that stuck around for nearly a year and a half 
Worked with all sorts of teams - Marketing, Operations, Sales, and IT 
Played around with and built out insights from Google Analytics and Adobe Omniture on a global scale 
Test drove Marketing Automation software (Aprimo, Eloqua, Marketo),  
Rebuilt landed pages with Optimizely and Unbounce 
Created an internal website (Sharepoint) for sales and marketing education 
Cut the time to process new leads by 60% and was awarded Lean Six Sigma Green Belt Semi Finalist with Storisto (that was our 54 hour startup) Startup Weekend 2011  –  2011  (less than a year) Miami, FL Joined a spontaneous and lively team of 3 computer science Ph.D's 
Presented the competition, our business plan, technology, and financial plan to 5 judges and a 40 person room 
We won (whoohoo!) 2nd place out of 60 participants and 10 entries 
Storisto was a network that allowed anyone to sell exclusive breaking news footage to CNN, FOX, MSNBC, and NBC Developer, SEO Analyst, Growth Hacker, Every Hat I Could Miami's Community Newspapers 2007  –  2011  (4 years) Miami, FL Built the website for www.communitynewspapers.com 
Started off with no traffic but grew to millions of visitors and thousands of sales a month 
Built our own version of groupon and realized how hard/fun/exciting e-commerce can be 
Cut my teeth on HTML/CSS, Javascript, PHP, Flash (not an expert but the working knowledge is there) 
Built landing pages by hand then realized how much better it is to use Optimizely and Unbounce 
Used Mailchimp to send out million+ emails a month, ran A/B tests, and drove traffic to conversion 
Used Growth Hacking principals to increase subscriber base by 300% over a few months
